pkgmetadata.longdescription: strings=============Python strings for humans.Usage:.. code-block:: python >>> from strings import string >>> s = string("Hello, World") >>> s 'Hello, World' >>> s.len() 12 >>> s.length 12 >>> s.size 12 >>> s + ", What?" Traceback (most recent call last): File "strings.py", line 27, in <module> x = s.add(", world") File "strings.py", line 20, in add return self + string(value) File "strings.py", line 23, in __add__ raise NotImplementedError("Use add instead") NotImplementedError: Use add instead >>> s.add(", What?") 'Hello, World, What?' Background-----------Inspired by an April Fool's Day joke.
